title: Calling a C function with a wrong type from Miri results in panic

labels.name: A-shims
labels.description: Area: This affects the external function and intrinsic shims

labels.name: E-easy
labels.description: An easy issue: a good way to start contributing, mentoring is available

body:
<!--

### Code

```Rust
extern "C" {
    fn malloc(size: u32) -> *mut std::ffi::c_void;
}

fn main() {
    unsafe { malloc(42) };
}
```

https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=c161d6b819c07b126414739cf6e32274


### Meta
<!--

bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->
